com.whirvis.jraknet.server

Class RakNetServer

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.whirvis.jraknet.server.RakNetServer
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    RakNetServerListener
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    ChatServer

    public class RakNetServer
extends java.lang.Object
implements RakNetServerListener
    Used to create servers using the RakNet protocol.
    Since:
    JRakNet v1.0.0
    Author:
    Trent "Whirvis" Summerlin

    • Constructor Detail

      • RakNetServer

        public RakNetServer(java.net.InetSocketAddress address,
                    int maximumTransferUnit,
                    int maxConnections,
                    Identifier identifier)
             throws java.lang.NullPointerException,
                    java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Creates a RakNet server.
        Parameters:
        address - the address the server will bind to during startup. A null IP address will have the server bind to the wildcard address.
        maximumTransferUnit - the highest maximum transfer unit a client can use. The maximum transfer unit is the maximum number of bytes that can be sent in one packet. If a packet exceeds this size, it is automatically split up so that it can still be sent over the connection (this is handled automatically by RakNetPeer). A value of -1 will have the maximum transfer unit be determined automatically via RakNet.getMaximumTransferUnit(InetAddress) with the parameter being the specified bind address.
        maxConnections - the maximum number of connections, A value of -1 will allow for an infinite number of connections.
        identifier - the identifier that will be sent in response to server pings if server broadcasting is enabled. A null identifier means nothing will be sent in response to server pings, even if server broadcasting is enabled.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if the address is null.
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the maximum connections is less than 0 and not equal to -1 or the maximum transfer unit size is less than and is not equal to -1.

      • RakNetServer

                    int maxConnections,

        Parameters:

        maximumTransferUnit - the highest maximum transfer unit a client can use. The maximum transfer unit is the maximum number of bytes that can be sent in one packet. If a packet exceeds this size, it is automatically split up so that it can still be sent over the connection (this is handled automatically by RakNetPeer). A value of -1 will have the maximum transfer unit be determined automatically via RakNet.getMaximumTransferUnit(InetAddress) with the parameter being the specified bind address.
        maxConnections - the maximum number of connections, A value of -1 will allow for an infinite number of connections.

        public RakNetServer(java.lang.String host,
                    int port,
                    int maximumTransferUnit,
                    int maxConnections,
                    Identifier identifier)
             throws java.net.UnknownHostException,
                    java.lang.NullPointerException,
                    java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Creates a RakNet server.
        Parameters:
        host - the IP address the server will bind to during startup. A null IP address will have the server bind to the wildcard address.
        port - the port the server will bind to during startup.
        maximumTransferUnit - the highest maximum transfer unit a client can use. The maximum transfer unit is the maximum number of bytes that can be sent in one packet. A value of -1 will have the maximum transfer unit be determined automatically via RakNet.getMaximumTransferUnit(InetAddress) with the parameter being the specified bind address.
        maxConnections - the maximum number of connections, A value of -1 will allow for an infinite number of connections.
        identifier - the identifier that will be sent in response to server pings if server broadcasting is enabled. A null identifier means nothing will be sent in response to server pings, even if server broadcasting is enabled.
        Throws:
        java.net.UnknownHostException - if no IP address for the bindAddress could be found, or if a scope_id was specified for a global IPv6 address.
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if the address is null.
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the maximum connections is less than 0 and not equal to -1 or the maximum transfer unit size is less than and is not equal to -1.

      • RakNetServer

        public RakNetServer(java.lang.String host,
                    int port,
                    int maxConnections,
                    Identifier identifier)
             throws java.net.UnknownHostException,
                    java.lang.NullPointerException,
                    java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Creates a RakNet server.
        Parameters:
        host - the IP address the server will bind to during startup. A null IP address will have the server bind to the wildcard address.
        port - the port the server will bind to during startup.
        maxConnections - the maximum number of connections, A value of -1 will allow for an infinite number of connections.
        identifier - the identifier that will be sent in response to server pings if server broadcasting is enabled. A null identifier means nothing will be sent in response to server pings, even if server broadcasting is enabled.
        Throws:
        java.net.UnknownHostException - if no IP address for the bindAddress could be found, or if a scope_id was specified for a global IPv6 address.
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if the address is null.
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the maximum connections is less than 0 and not equal to -1.

      • RakNetServer

        public RakNetServer(java.lang.String host,
                    int port,
                    int maximumTransferUnit,
                    int maxConnections)
             throws java.net.UnknownHostException,
                    java.lang.NullPointerException,
                    java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Creates a RakNet server.
        Parameters:
        host - the IP address the server will bind to during startup. A null IP address will have the server bind to the wildcard address.
        port - the port the server will bind to during startup.
        maximumTransferUnit - the highest maximum transfer unit a client can use. The maximum transfer unit is the maximum number of bytes that can be sent in one packet. If a packet exceeds this size, it is automatically split up so that it can still be sent over the connection (this is handled automatically by RakNetPeer). A value of -1 will have the maximum transfer unit be determined automatically via RakNet.getMaximumTransferUnit(InetAddress) with the parameter being the specified bind address.
        maxConnections - the maximum number of connections, A value of -1 will allow for an infinite number of connections.
        Throws:
        java.net.UnknownHostException - if no IP address for the bindAddress could be found, or if a scope_id was specified for a global IPv6 address.
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if the address is null.
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the maximum connections is less than 0 and not equal to -1 or the maximum transfer unit size is less than and is not equal to -1.

      • RakNetServer

        public RakNetServer(java.lang.String host,
                    int port,
                    int maxConnections)
             throws java.net.UnknownHostException,
                    java.lang.NullPointerException,
                    java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Creates a RakNet server.
        Parameters:

        port - the port the server will bind to during startup.
        maxConnections - the maximum number of connections, A value of -1 will allow for an infinite number of connections.
        Throws:
        java.net.UnknownHostException - if no IP address for the bindAddress could be found, or if a scope_id was specified for a global IPv6 address.
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if the address is null.
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the maximum connections is less than 0 and not equal to -1.

      • sendMessage

        public final EncapsulatedPacket sendMessage(long guid,
                                            Reliability reliability,
                                            int channel,
                                            Packet packet)
                                     throws java.lang.NullPointerException,
                                            java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Sends a message to the specified peer.
        Parameters:
        guid - the globally unique ID of the peer to send the packet to.
        reliability - the reliability of the packet.
        channel - the channel to send the packet on.
        packet - the packet to send.
        Returns:
        the generated encapsulated packet, null if no packet was sent due to the non existence of the peer with the guid. This is normally not important, however it can be used for packet acknowledged and not acknowledged events if the reliability is of the WITH_ACK_RECEIPT type.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if the reliability or packet are null.
        InvalidChannelException - if the channel is higher than or equal to .
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException

        buf - the buffer to send.
        Returns:
        the generated encapsulated packet, null if no packet was sent due to the inexistence of the peer with the guid. This is normally not important, however it can be used for packet acknowledged and not acknowledged events if the reliability is of the WITH_ACK_RECEIPT type.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if the reliability or buf are null.

      • sendMessage

                                            Reliability reliability,
                                            io.netty.buffer.ByteBuf buf)
                                     throws java.lang.NullPointerException,
                                            java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Sends messages to the specified peer on the default channel.
        Parameters:
        peer - the peer to send the packet to.
        reliability - the reliability of the packet.
        buf - the buffer to send.
        Returns:
        the generated encapsulated packet, null if no packet was sent due to the non existence of the peer with the guid. This is normally not important, however it can be used for packet acknowledged and not acknowledged events if the reliability is of the WITH_ACK_RECEIPT type.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if the peer, reliability or buf are null.
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the peer is not of the server.

                                            Reliability reliability,
                                            int channel,
                                            int packetId)
                                     throws java.lang.NullPointerException,
                                            InvalidChannelException
        Sends a message identifier to the specified peer.
        Parameters:
        guid - the globally unique ID of the peer to send the packet to.
        reliability - the reliability of the message identifier.
        channel - the channel to send the message identifier on.
        packetId - the message identifier to send.
        Returns:
        the generated encapsulated packet, null if no packet was sent due to the non existence of the peer with the guid. This is normally not important, however it can be used for packet acknowledged and not acknowledged events if the reliability is of the WITH_ACK_RECEIPT type.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if the reliability is null.
        InvalidChannelException - if the channel is higher than or equal to .

      • disconnect

        public final boolean disconnect(RakNetClientPeer peer,
                                java.lang.String reason)
                         throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Disconnects a client from the server.
        Parameters:
        peer - the peer of the client to disconnect.

        true if a client was disconnected, false otherwise.

      • blockAddress

        public final void blockAddress(java.net.InetAddress address,
                               java.lang.String reason,
                               long time)
                        throws java.lang.NullPointerException
        Blocks the specified IP address.

        All currently connected clients with the IP address (regardless of port) will be disconnected with the same reason that the IP address was blocked.

        Parameters:
        address - the IP address to block.
        reason - the reason the address was blocked. A null reason will have "Address blocked" be used as the reason instead.
        time - how long the address will blocked in milliseconds.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if address is null.

      • blockAddress

        public final void blockAddress(java.net.InetAddress address,
                               long time)
                        throws java.lang.NullPointerException
        Blocks the specified IP address.

        All currently connected clients with the IP address (regardless of port) will be disconnected with the same reason that the IP address was blocked.

        Parameters:
        address - the IP address to block.
        time - how long the address will blocked in milliseconds.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if address is null.

      • validateSender

        private final RakNetPacket validateSender(java.net.InetSocketAddress sender,
                                          long guid)
                                   throws java.lang.NullPointerException
        Validates the sender of a packet.

        This is called throughout initial client connection to make sure there are no issues.

        Parameters:
        sender - the address of the packet sender.
        guid - the globally unique ID of the sender, -1 if there is none.
        Returns:
        the packet to respond with if there was an error, null if there are no issues.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if the sender is null.

      • sendNettyMessage

        public final void sendNettyMessage(io.netty.buffer.ByteBuf buf,
                                   java.net.InetSocketAddress address)
                            throws java.lang.NullPointerException
        Sends a Netty message over the channel raw.

        This should be used sparingly, as if it is used incorrectly it could break client peers entirely. In order to send a message to a peer, use one of the sendMessage() methods.

        Parameters:
        buf - the buffer to send.
        address - the address to send the buffer to.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if the buf, address, or IP address of the address are null.

        Parameters:

        address - the address to send the packet to.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if the packet, address, or IP address of the address are null.
